Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2020.11.01]NuGetGallery of dev into master" (#8308) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Dropping the narration completely for absent signature and deprecation information" (#8309) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Another take on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8196 (Previous attempt: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8287)

The expectation actually was that empty cells are not read completely by a narrator, instead of producing an explanation regarding why the cell is empty.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][WCAG2.1][ARIA]Some status/alert messages are not being read out." (#8284) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Concerning the following:
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1061326
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1061322
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1069948

Fixes  need to be made for the following pages/scenarios:
1. Copy for install instructions on package details page
Steps to Reproduce :
    1. Launch application using provided URL.(https://www.nuget.org/)
    2. Navigated to Home page
    3. Search for a key term (say “json”)
    4. Look at the package search results and select any package.
    5. Navigate till "Package Manager" and select it.
    6. Start Narrator and navigate till "Copy" control.
    7. Hit enter on the "Copy" control and observe the announcement by screen reader.
2. API Key Generation success message
Steps to Reproduce :
    1. Launch application using provided URL.(https://www.nuget.org/)
    2. Navigated to Home page
    3. Click on “Sign in” option (top right) and click on “Sign in with Microsoft” button
    4. Sign in using MSA on the common Microsoft sign-in page
    5. Go to “API Keys” from the context menu (top left menu dropdown).
    6. Navigate till "Create Control" and expand it.
    7. Fill all the data in the editing fields.
    8. Start Narrator, click on the "Create" button and observe the announcement by screen reader.
3. Deprecation dialog status messages
Repro Steps:​ Note Same issue was observed on "GitHub Usage" page
    1. Start Screen Reader. Hit the URL "https://www.nuget.org" and sign in with valid credentials​
    2. Tab till "Sign In" link in the top navigation and press enter​
    3. Tab till "Sign in with Microsoft" button and press enter​
    4. Select valid user id and press enter​
    5. Enter any Username, tab till "Register" button and press enter​
    6. Tab till the user menu button and press enter to expand it. Select "Manage Packages" and press enter​
    7. Tab till "Published Packages", expand it and select any existing package.(If no packages are available, add a new package)​
    8. Tab till "Manage Package" link under "Info" and press enter​
    9. Tab till "Deprecation" section and press enter to expand it​
    10. Tab till "Select reason(s)" and uncheck all the check boxes. A status message will be displayed on the screen
    11. Check if the screen reader is reading the status message​

Notes:
All of these are likely missing aria-live regions describing them. Including an aria-live and role to the respective elements that need to be read out should be sufficient. See https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8238 for an example of a fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS19 Package Restore repeats 14 times" (#9686) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Our Visual Studio solution (146 projects) often repeatedly restores nuget packages. This, combined with an [issue with the Fast Up To Date check](https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/6227), means that our builds are much slower than necessary.

Any ideas why this should happen? Are there additional diagnostics I can turn on (for the fast up to date check, I had to fiddle with the VS private registry hives)

> Restoring NuGet packages...
> ....
> 60 of 146 projects are up-to-date for restore.
> Time Elapsed: 00:00:10.4271022
> ========== Finished ==========
> 
> 
> Restoring NuGet packages...
> ....
> 65 of 146 projects are up-to-date for restore.
> NuGet package restore finished.
> Time Elapsed: 00:00:14.1169620
> ========== Finished ==========
> 
> 
> Restoring NuGet packages...
> ....
> 3 of 146 projects are up-to-date for restore.
> Time Elapsed: 00:00:15.0899035
> ========== Finished ==========

Using Visual Studio Version 16.6.2.
I attached sanitized package manager log. Restore was repeated 14 times in total (got bored trimming the log at around half that)

[RepeatedNugetRestore.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/4785575/RepeatedNugetRestore.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	· **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**  – 48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
 
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	· UTC-9 to UTC-2 – [Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	· UTC-1 to UTC+6 – [Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	· UTC+7 to UTC-10 – [Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
